```{r question6, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
```

Comment on the summary statistics and distribution of the ABV variable.
```{r}
summary(merged$ABV)
```

The mean is slightly higher than the median, which would indicate a right skewed distribution,
one with a long tail of high values.

```{r}
merged %>% drop_na(ABV) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=ABV)) + geom_histogram(aes(y=..density..),bins=31) + 
  ggtitle('Histogram of ABV values') +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept=median(ABV)),color='blue',linetype='dashed',size=1) +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept=mean(ABV)), color='red',linetype='dotted',size=1) +
  geom_density(alpha=.2,fill="#FF6666")
```

The histogram bears this out.
